history.text: hello
hello
Do you know what is the name of the movie?
Yes, the movie is Bruce Almighty. Have you seen it?
Not yet. What is it about?

It is a comedy that has Jim Carrey as the main character. He is a TV reporter and complains to God (played by Morgan Freeman) that he is not doing his job correctly, so Freeman gives his job of playing God to Carrey.
It was rated a 5.7/10 on Rotten Tomatoes.
It also has Jennifer Aniston as well.
I like Jim Carrey, I think he is funny. But the ratings is not so good. What do you think about the movie?
It has some funny parts, not all of it is funny.
any good moments in the movie?
Carrey gets carried away with spoiling himself and forgets that there's a lot of people that ned help.
A new document popped up on my side, but it is blank.
Weird?
hmm i don't have a document. Is it a family movie? I mean can I watch with my kids?
I guess it depends on your kid's ages.
4 and 7?
Like, in one scene, he decides to change his girlfriend's boob sizes to be bigger.
I don't know if that is quite appropriate
He also uses his powers as God to blow a girls skirt up.
I can't think of any other inappropriate/sexual things in it.
It is just a slap-stick comedy for sure.
ah ok probably not a good idea to watch it with kids.
I guess its a religious movie? since it is about God?
Not really, just basically like, His job is hard.
Like, at one scene, Carrey keeps hearing voices.
And it is explained that he hasn't been answering prayers.
So he instead organizes these requests by sorting them into an email.
So he starts answering them, and gets  a bit overwhelmed.

So then he just replies
 "yes" to everyone.
So then a bunch of people win the lottery at the same time.
He hasn't been answering prayers? God or Carrey?
Carrey
He was just playing with the new given powers.
Interesting.
Like, blowing up a girl's skirt or pulling the moon closer to impress his girlfriend.
Is Jennifer his girlfriend in the movie?
In another key scene, God appears and tells Bruce (Carrey) to pray what he truly wants. And he prays for Jennifer (yes, his girlfriend) to find a man that would make her happy.
They end up getting engaged on tv (since hes a reporter).

While there are funny parts, the movie brings a lot of other issues to light. You can't just do what you want, or tell everyone yes to their prayers, there are consequences
 for everything.
what year it was released?
wow it is an old movie
I haven't heard of CinemaScore, but they rated the movie an A
Metracritic Score is 46/100
It is something to kind of put on in the background and laugh at here and there.
Nice. I will search to see if I can watch it on prime. Thank you!

uid1response.feedback: There was a blank page that popped up, not sure what that was about, but the first page was adding paragraphs.
